comments:
I20070208-0010

ContextAuthority$1.widgetDisposed(..) does not handle the case where the shell is already disposed. It should check whether newShell has been disposed before calling newShell.removeDisposeListener(this).

To reproduce, remove the asyncExec(..) workaround in HEAD of org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.refactoring.reorg.RenameInformationPopup.PopupVisibilityManager.start().new DisposeListener() {...}.widgetDisposed(DisposeEvent).

in I20070322-1800
PW
Verified in client code by removing workaround, and then clicking "Open Dialog..." in the in-place rename refactoring popup.

In ContextAuthority, there's a second DisposeListener which probably suffers from the same problem if the shell is already disposed when the listener is serviced.
OK, got that one as well.
PW
